title: Trump Uses Shutdown to Maximize Pain for Democrats and Move Forward With Layoffs
summary: The Trump administration forged ahead with plans to conduct mass layoffs, as the fiscal standoff appeared to intensify.

title: Trump to Withhold $18 Billion for New York-Area Transit Projects
summary: Funds for two of the nation’s largest infrastructure projects, the Second Avenue subway and Hudson River tunnels, are being held up in apparent attempts to pressure Democrats amid a government shutdown.

title: ‘Dangerous Cities,’ the Military, Trump and the Founding Fathers
summary: The U.S. armed services have long sought to preserve the tradition of a nonpartisan military.

title: Drones, Helicopters, Hundreds of Arrests: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown in Chicago So Far
summary: The administration announced a federal operation in the Chicago area more than three weeks ago. Agents have appeared along downtown streets, and National Guard troops are expected.

title: How Washington Became a Testing Ground for ICE
summary: A series of arrests captured on video reveal how immigration officers have worked with other law enforcement agencies to identify migrants during stops for minor infractions.

title: The Dodgers United Los Angeles. Then the ICE Raids Began.
summary: For decades, the Dodgers have been the pride of L.A.’s Latino community. Trump’s immigration raids are testing that.

title: ‘There Will Always Only Be One Jane Goodall’
summary: Scientists reflect on the life and work of a researcher whose discoveries made them rethink what it means to be human.

title: Jane Goodall, Revered Chimpanzee Expert and Conservationist, Dies at 91
summary: Her discoveries as a primatologist in the 1960s about how chimpanzees behave in the wild were hailed as “one of the Western world’s great scientific achievements.”

title: Jane Goodall: A Life in Pictures
summary: The primatologist gained scientific acclaim for her work with chimpanzees and then later used her fame to champion conservation.

title: Jane Goodall’s Thoughts for a Reporter: ‘Hope Isn’t Just Wishful Thinking’
summary: A Times correspondent who interviewed Dr. Goodall recalled their conversations about the state of the planet.

title: Trump Administration Asks Colleges to Sign ‘Compact’ to Get Funding Preference
summary: Demands sent to nine top schools included pledging to freeze tuition for five years and to commit to strict definitions of gender.

title: Trump Fires Members of Humanities Council
summary: The White House told members of a group of scholars who advise the National Endowment for the Humanities that their positions had been terminated.

title: Israel Intercepts Boats Headed to Gaza With Humanitarian Aid
summary: The boats were part of a flotilla, carrying Greta Thunberg and other activists, that was organized to break Israel’s blockade and protest the war.

title: How Social Media Is Changing the Narrative of the Israel-Gaza War
summary: Nearly two years into the conflict, social media is increasingly capturing the day-to-day toll in Gaza, as U.S. public opinion on the war shifts.

title: Did the Yankees Try to Keep Red Sox Fans Out of the Bronx?
summary: Not exactly, but to the thousands of Boston fans who attended the first game of the Wild Card series at Yankee Stadium, it was a welcome reason to root against the home team.

title: In East Timor, U.S. Retreats From Plan to Build ‘Lifesaving’ Sewage Plant
summary: A U.S. aid agency had committed hundreds of millions of dollars to the project, which could help provide clean water. Now its board wants to pull out of the agreement.

title: When Taylor Swift Met Her ‘Life of a Showgirl’ Partner Max Martin
summary: The pop star and the Swedish producer connected on her 2012 LP, “Red.” They’ve reunited (with his collaborator Shellback) for “The Life of a Showgirl.”

title: Brussels Is the Heart of Europe, and It’s Not Going Well
summary: Brussels is nearing the end of its experiment in urban autonomy.

title: How to Beat an Autocrat at the Ballot Box
summary: Authoritarians have lost elections before, and they will again.

title: How Broken Politics Breaks Courts
summary: We look at the difficult position of independent courts and judges at a time when countries around the world are deeply divided.

title: Two Planes Collide on LaGuardia Airport Taxiway
summary: A plane that was preparing to take off struck a plane that had landed, the authorities said. One passenger was injured.

title: She Loved Eric Adams. She Kept It a Secret. Now She’s Talking.
summary: Jasmine Ray, who served at City Hall in a $160,000-a-year job, had an undisclosed romance with Eric Adams years before he became mayor. In her memoir, she describes their relationship.

title: Edward T. Blake, 80, Dies; Forensic Expert Sparked Innocence Movement
summary: He was the first to use PCR testing on crime-scene DNA, inspiring a practice that has freed thousands of wrongfully convicted people.

title: ‘She Could Have Killed Me’: Scientist Survives Shark Bite to His Head
summary: “My whole head was inside of her mouth,” Mauricio Hoyos, a marine scientist from Mexico, said from a hospital in Costa Rica.
